Usage

Installation

To use tcr-converter, first install it by cloning this repo and from the top-level folder running:

$ pip install -e .

Functions

convert.convert_tcr()

convert.convert_tcr(df, fmt_from=['tenx', 'adaptive', 'adaptive_v2', 'imgt'], fmt_to=['tenx', 'adaptive', 'adaptive_v2', 'imgt'], cols_use=None, extract_tcr=False, convert_cols=False)

Convert TCR gene names from one naming convention to another.

Parameters:

  • df (dataframe) – Dataframe of TCRs

  • fmt_from (str) – Starting format of TCR data

  • fmt_to (str) – Format to convert TCR data to

  • cols_use (list or tuple, optional) – List or tuple of current V, J, and CDR3 column names

  • extract_tcr (bool, optional) – Whether to return only the V, J, and CDR3 columns

  • convert_cols (bool, optional) – Whether to convert column names to match new format

Returns:

Converted TCR data

Return type:

dataframe

build_lookup.main()

build_lookup.main()

Runs all functions necessary to make a lookup table.

Returns:

None

build_lookup.parse_imgt_fasta()

build_lookup.parse_imgt_fasta(infile)

Extract gene names from an IMGT reference fasta.

Parameters:

infile (str) – IMGT reference fasta for TRAV, TRAJ, TRBV, or TRBJ

Returns:

Gene names

Return type:

list

build_lookup.extract_imgt_genes()

build_lookup.extract_imgt_genes(data_dir)

Extract gene names from all IMGT reference fasta files in a folder.

Parameters:

data_dir (str) – Directory containing IMGT reference fasta files

Returns:

Gene names

Return type:

dataframe

build_lookup.pad_single_digit()

build_lookup.pad_single_digit(s)

Add a ‘0’ to single-digit gene names to match double-digit adaptive format.
